definition: loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)
loose/slack/(fig.) to soften (policies, tone of voice)/to give some slack/(of a place) not crowded
to relax/to relax efforts/to slack off/to take it easy/complacent/undisciplined
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
flexible/not rigid/spongy/soft or runny (not set hard)/loose (soil)
to let go of sth held in one's mouth/(fig.) to relent/to yield
to relinquish one's grip/to let go
to heave a sigh of relief

sentences.english: The shoelace has relaxed , the place also should go to a nobody has finished being.
sentences.chinese: 鞋帶鬆了，也應走到沒人的地方繫好。

sentences.english: Almost all the bottom of the cases were loose.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎所有的外箱底部都鬆了。

sentences.english: The place to see son has red flag finally relieved.
sentences.chinese: 見兒子有了去處，文紅旗終於鬆了口氣。

sentences.english: Sometime God speaks through whispering pine.
sentences.chinese: 有時神透過鬆濤低語說話。

sentences.english: Since she has lost weight that skirt bags on her.
sentences.chinese: 因爲她減肥了，她穿那條裙子顯得太鬆垂了。

sentences.english: Taking boat pass the Songhua river and saw the sun island.
sentences.chinese: 乘船渡過鬆花江，看到了太陽島。

sentences.english: Cindy:He let out a sigh of relief when he found out the baby was a brother.
sentences.chinese: 當他知道小北鼻是弟弟時，還鬆了一口氣呢。

sentences.english: There must be a loose wire in my radio somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 我的收音機肯定什麼地方有條線鬆了。

sentences.english: On Thursday, the yen selloff gave other Asian currencies a breather.
sentences.chinese: 週四，日圓拋售潮讓亞洲其他貨幣鬆了口氣。

sentences.english: He heaved a great breath and turned, remembering Carrie.
sentences.chinese: 他大大地鬆了一口氣，想起了嘉莉，便轉過身去。

sentences.english: They went on a pinic in a Country park to take barbecue.
sentences.chinese: 他們繼續一鬆在國家公園採取烤肉。

sentences.english: A sigh of relief, but one moment, what about Sandro?
sentences.chinese: 這真讓人鬆了一口氣，但是，桑德羅呢？

sentences.english: C. Yes, and I'm relieved that we did.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我們這麼做真令我鬆了口氣。

sentences.english: She needs to be brushed and one shoe is loose.
sentences.chinese: 它需要刷毛了，一隻馬掌鬆了。

sentences.english: He let out another sigh of relief.
Where the knot is loose the string slips.
sentences.chinese: 結子一鬆掉，繩子就滑脫。

definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
pad/cushion/mat/to pad out/to fill a gap/to pay for sb/to advance (money)
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
